Column Comment.0: LEGAL LOCATION ID: unique identifier for the legal location
Column Comment.1: LOCATION TYPE: A reference table identifying the type of obj ect being given a legallocation. For example, node, well, ...
Column Comment.2: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: LOCAL COORDINATE SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the localcoordinate system, such as a local grid system (ATS, STS, MTS etc) to which thesecoordinates have been referenced. Coordinates that are referenced to a localcoordinate system are usually surveyed relative to the local system using metes andbounds or local survey references; maintaining the position of each point relative toits referenced local system is very important to survey accuracy.
Column Comment.5: EVENT SEQUENCE: Number indicating the sequence for each well event (e.g.,0=original oil well, 1=re-entry, etc.).
Column Comment.6: LEGAL SUBDIVISION: Number for the Legal Subdivision (LSD) within a Canadiansection. Sections are divided into 16 legal subdivisions.
Column Comment.7: LOCATION EXCEPTION: Code designating a well location not conforming to normalwell spacing and only with government authorization.
Column Comment.8: MERIDIAN: DLS meridian number. Values lie between 1-6.
Column Comment.9: MERIDIAN DIRECTION: E(ast) or W(est) indicating the direction of the principalmeridian.
Column Comment.10: RANGE: Number identifying the whole or partial range. Values lie between 1 - 34.
Column Comment.11: RANGE MODIFIER: The letter A differentiates duplicate range numbers (located onlyin Saskatchewan). Occurs when DLS survey systems 1 and 3 overlap causingduplicate Range numbers.
Column Comment.12: SECTION: Number designating the section within a township (1-36).
Column Comment.13: TOWNSHIP: Number identifying a whole or partial township. Values lie between1-120.
Column Comment.14: TOWNSHIP MODIFIER: The letter A differentiates duplicate township numbers(located only in Saskatchewan). Occurs where DLS survey systems 1 and 3 overlapcreating duplicate township numbers.
Column Comment.15: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.16: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.17: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.18: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.19: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.20: NODE IDENTIFIER: Unique identification number assigned to a specific point (node)
Column Comment.21: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.22: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.23: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.24: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.25: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.26: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.27: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
